content.text:
You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to describe a target word for another player to guess.

Rules:
(a) You have to reply in the form: CLUE: <some text>. Guesses from the other player will start with GUESS.
(b) You cannot use the target word itself, parts or morphological variants of it in your description.
(c) In addition, the same rules apply for related words which are provided below.

End conditions:
(i) If you use the target word or a related word in your description, then you lose.
(ii) If the other player can guess the target word in 3 tries, you both win.

Let us start.

This is the target word that you need to describe and that the other player needs to guess:

primarily

Related words are:

- primary
- focus
- principally

Important: You are under time pressure, give short descriptions that are to the point!

content.thinking:
I need to provide a clue for the word "primarily" without using the word itself or the related words "primary", "focus", or "principally".

"Primarily" means mainly, chiefly, or for the most part. It indicates that something is the main or most important element.

I need to create a concise clue that captures this meaning without using any of the forbidden words.

Some potential ways to describe "primarily":
- Mostly
- Mainly
- Chiefly
- For the most part
- Above all else
- First and foremost
- Predominantly
- Largely

I think a good clue would be something like:
"This adverb means 'mainly' or 'for the most part'"

This is concise, clear, and avoids all the forbidden words. It also gives the part of speech (adverb) which might be helpful for the guesser.

Let me check once more that I'm not using any of the forbidden words:
- primarily (the target word) - not used
- primary (related word) - not used
- focus (related word) - not used
- principally (related word) - not used

My clue looks good!

content.text: CLUE: This adverb means "mainly" or "for the most part" when describing the main importance of something.

clem_player.response: CLUE: This adverb means "mainly" or "for the most part" when describing the main importance of something.

content.text:
You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to guess a target word that another player describes to you.

You can make one guess at each trial. You win when you guess the target word. You lose when you cannot guess it in 3 tries.

After each trial you will get a new hint from the other player which starts with CLUE.

Make your guesses by just saying the word using the following form: GUESS: <a word>

Let us start.


CLUE: This adverb means "mainly" or "for the most part" when describing the main importance of something.

content.thinking:
The clue is asking for an adverb that means "mainly" or "for the most part" when describing the main importance of something.

Some adverbs that have this meaning include:
- Primarily
- Mainly
- Mostly
- Chiefly
- Predominantly
- Principally
- Largely
- Essentially
- Substantially
- Fundamentally

Of these options, "primarily" seems to be the most direct match for the meaning "mainly" or "for the most part" when describing the main importance of something. It's commonly used in contexts where we want to emphasize that something is the main or chief reason, purpose, or characteristic.

So I'll guess "primarily".

content.text:
I need to guess an adverb that means "mainly" or "for the most part" when describing the main importance of something.

GUESS: primarily

GUESS: primarily
